title: Stored XSS templates -> 'call for action' feature
content:
Hi Jeff,
Reporting the Stored XSS in template section on 'call for action' button. (Already discussed in mail)
1] Login to Mixmax and navigate to template section
2] Click on enhance and select call for action button
3] Enter anything in button text and in URL enter XSS payload (javascript:alert(document.cookie))
4] Insert the button and click it to execute XSS.
Impact : XSS can be stored in template and when Team manager/admin uses that template and clicks the button , our XSS executes
Thank you
steps: Login to Mixmax and navigate to template section
Click on enhance and select call for action button
Enter anything in button text and in URL enter XSS payload (javascript:alert(document.cookie))
Insert the button and click it to execute XSS
vuln_description: Stored XSS in template section on 'call for action' button. The XSS payload is stored in the template and executed when the button is clicked by any user, including team managers/admins.
reason: The vulnerability involves a straightforward injection of a common XSS payload into a URL field, which is a well-known attack vector. The steps to reproduce are simple and do not require complex interactions or understanding of subtle application logic.
